title: AI Academy premium course & ebook sales website (frontend)

requirements.summary: Establish a premium dark theme with royal blue/purple gradients, glassmorphism surfaces, smooth animations, mobile responsiveness, and professional typography applied consistently site-wide.
acceptanceCriteria: Site uses a dark theme with royal blue/purple gradient accents and white text, and the theme is visually consistent across all sections.
All primary content surfaces (cards/sections) use a glassmorphism-style treatment (blur/translucency) while maintaining readable contrast.
Buttons/cards have clear hover/focus states and subtle animation (e.g., transform/opacity) without harming performance.
Layout adapts cleanly to mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.

file_operations.description: Add Poppins and/or Inter font loading (e.g., via Google Fonts) and ensure the document is set up for a dark premium look without changing user-facing copy.
Create global Tailwind entry styles, theme tokens/variables for dark UI, gradient accents, glassmorphism utilities (blur/translucent surfaces), and consistent typography defaults.
Extend Tailwind theme to support the royal blue/purple gradient palette, glassmorphism-friendly tokens (e.g., translucent card colors), and animation utilities for smooth hover/scroll effects.
Create a reusable GlassCard wrapper component implementing consistent glassmorphism styling and accessible focus/hover states.
Create a reusable Section component for consistent spacing, max-width behavior, and responsive layout across homepage sections.

requirements.summary: Implement the homepage with all required sections, exact hero copy/CTAs, WhatsApp navigation, and a complete footer.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage renders all requested sections in the same order (Hero, Featured Courses, Ebook Store, Why Choose, Testimonials/Results, Pricing & Offers, WhatsApp CTA, Footer).
Hero section displays the exact heading/subtext and three CTA buttons with the exact labels.
“Join WhatsApp” CTA navigates to WhatsApp chat for +91 8171739752.
Footer includes About AI Academy text area, contact info, a WhatsApp link/button, social media icon placeholders/links, and copyright line.

file_operations.description: Create the application shell, wire in homepage rendering as the default route/view, and include shared layout elements (header/footer hooks) needed for navigation between sections and pages.
Implement the homepage with the required section order and exact hero copy/CTA labels; include in-page anchors/refs for Featured Courses and Ebook Store sections for CTA scrolling.
Implement footer content (About, contact info, WhatsApp link/button, social icon placeholders/links, copyright) with premium dark styling.
Implement a premium header that includes primary navigation and at least one WhatsApp entry point while remaining mobile responsive.
Centralize WhatsApp URL construction for +91 8171739752 and expose a helper used by all WhatsApp CTAs to ensure consistency.

requirements.summary: Show data-driven listings for exactly 4 featured courses and 4 ebooks with name/price/image/buy actions; wire hero CTAs to scroll to the relevant sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Featured Courses section displays exactly 4 course cards with name, price, image, and a “Buy” action.
Ebook Store section displays exactly 4 ebook cards with name, price, cover image, and an “Instant Buy” action.
Clicking “View Courses” moves the user to the Featured Courses section; clicking “Buy Ebooks” moves the user to the Ebook Store section.
Catalog data is sourced from the backend so prices/images/titles can be updated centrally without rebuilding the frontend.

file_operations.description: Create React Query hooks that use useActor() to fetch products from the backend (by type) and expose loading/error states for the homepage.

Create a reusable product card (glassmorphism) that renders backend-sourced name/price/image and a buy button; use shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Button/Card-like composition) for consistent behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement the Featured Courses section to render exactly the 4 required course products (filtered/selected by id/name from backend results) with buy actions and responsive layout.
Implement the Ebook Store section to render exactly the 4 required ebook products (filtered/selected by id/name from backend results) with instant buy actions and responsive layout.
Wire Hero CTAs “View Courses” and “Buy Ebooks” to scroll to the Featured Courses and Ebook Store sections (using refs/IDs) and ensure only the specified products appear.

requirements.summary: Integrate WhatsApp contact CTAs site-wide, including a dedicated banner and a persistent entry point.
acceptanceCriteria: All WhatsApp buttons/links open a WhatsApp chat to +91 8171739752 using a wa.me (or equivalent) URL.
A dedicated WhatsApp CTA banner section is present with the specified headline and a button to WhatsApp.
There is at least one additional WhatsApp entry point outside the banner (e.g., in header/footer or a floating button).

file_operations.description: Create the dedicated WhatsApp CTA banner section with the headline “Need Help? Chat on WhatsApp” and a button wired via the WhatsApp helper; style in premium glassmorphism theme.
Add a persistent floating WhatsApp entry point wired via the WhatsApp helper; ensure it’s accessible on mobile and doesn’t obstruct core CTAs.
Ensure the header contains a WhatsApp link/button that opens chat to +91 8171739752 using the centralized helper.
Ensure footer WhatsApp link/button uses the centralized helper and matches the premium theme.
Insert the WhatsApp CTA banner in the required homepage section order and ensure all WhatsApp CTAs (including hero “Join WhatsApp”) use the centralized helper.

requirements.summary: Implement a checkout UI with payment method selection and a backend-configured payment-link redirect strategy with WhatsApp fallback when missing.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking buy on any course/ebook opens a checkout UI listing Razorpay, UPI, Paytm, and Debit/Credit card as payment options.
For each product+payment-method combination, the system can be configured with a payment URL in the backend and the frontend will redirect to it when present.
If a payment URL is missing for a chosen method, the UI shows a clear fallback path that includes a WhatsApp contact link to +91 8171739752.
Purchase attempts are recorded (e.g., created as an order/intent) in the backend with product, price at time of purchase, and chosen payment method.

file_operations.description: Create a checkout modal/dialog that lists payment options (Razorpay, UPI, Paytm, Debit/Credit card), collects selection, and drives the purchase flow; use shadcn-ui Dialog/Button components for accessible UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create hooks/mutations that (1) create an order/intent via backend, (2) fetch the backend payment-link config for the selected method, (3) redirect to the external URL if present or show fallback instructions + WhatsApp link if not.
Wire the “Buy” / “Instant Buy” button to open the CheckoutDialog for the selected product.
Ensure homepage sections pass the correct product data to ProductCard and that buy actions consistently open the checkout UI.

requirements.summary: Provide gated instant ebook downloads after payment and a “My Downloads” page that lists paid ebook purchases for the current session/principal.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a user-facing page/section (“My Downloads” or equivalent) that lists ebooks that have been marked paid and shows a download button for each.
Ebook files are served as static assets from the frontend build (not streamed through the backend), and download access is gated by a backend-issued token or authorization check.
Unpaid ebook purchases do not show active download buttons.

Backend stores purchase/payment status for ebook orders and can transition an order from unpaid to paid (initial implementation may include a simple internal/admin-only method or a temporary UI action clearly labeled as a placeholder until real payment confirmation is wired).

file_operations.description: Create “My Downloads” page that fetches the caller’s downloads from backend, filters to ebook purchases, and shows status-aware download actions (disabled/hidden for unpaid).
Create a gated download route that reads a token from the URL, validates it with backend, and then redirects/initiates download of the corresponding static ebook asset.
Create React Query hooks to fetch downloads for the current principal/session and a mutation to request a download token for a paid order.
Add navigation entry to “My Downloads” and ensure it works on mobile.
Wire routes/views for “My Downloads” and the gated download page so they are reachable through navigation and token links.
Add a small UI component to display order/payment status consistently across the downloads UI.

Include a clearly labeled placeholder control (for development/testing) to trigger a backend state transition to paid when appropriate for the current order, without presenting it as real payment verification.

requirements.summary: Add a premium Testimonials/Student Results section with 4–6 review cards and an earnings-screenshot-style layout using placeholder assets.
acceptanceCriteria: Testimonials section shows between 4 and 6 testimonials with names/short quotes and a visual “results screenshot” style element per entry (or a subset).
Layout is responsive and maintains good spacing/typography on mobile.
Section styling matches the site theme (dark, gradient accents, glass cards).

file_operations.description: Implement Testimonials/Student Results section with 4–6 glassmorphism review cards and an earnings-screenshot-style visual layout using the generated result images.
Insert the Testimonials/Student Results section in the required order and ensure responsive spacing/typography matches the premium theme.

requirements.summary: Include required static images (logo, hero background, product thumbnails/covers, testimonial result screenshots) as frontend static assets and render them in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: All course cards show a thumbnail image; all ebook cards show a cover image; hero uses a premium background/visual.
Generated images are stored and referenced as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated (or equivalent static public directory).
No backend endpoint is required to fetch or transform images at runtime.

Add the generated hero background image as a static file for the homepage hero section.
Add the generated course thumbnail as a static file for AI Mastery Course.
Add the generated course thumbnail as a static file for ChatGPT Earning Course.

Add the generated ebook cover as a static file for Digital Marketing Ebook.
Add generated testimonial result screenshot-style image for use in Testimonials/Student Results section.
Add generated testimonial result screenshot-style image for use in Testimonials/Student Results section.
Add generated testimonial result screenshot-style image for use in Testimonials/Student Results section.
Add generated testimonial result screenshot-style image for use in Testimonials/Student Results section.

Render the hero background (frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-background.dim_1920x1080.png) and logo (frontend/public/assets/generated/ai-academy-logo.dim_512x256.png) as static assets in the hero/header; ensure product cards display their respective static images.
Wire result screenshot-style images from frontend/public/assets/generated/result-1.dim_900x600.png through frontend/public/assets/generated/result-4.dim_900x600.png into the testimonials layout.
